info.title: Ripple JSON-RPC
info.description: This API lets you interact with a rippled server via JSON-RPC

methods.name: account_channels
methods.description: The account_channels method returns information about an account's Payment Channels. This includes only channels where the specified account is the channel's source, not the destination. (A channel's 'source' and 'owner' are the same.) All information retrieved is relative to a particular version of the ledger.

params.name: destination_account
params.description: The unique identifier of an account, typically the account's Address. If provided, filter results to payment channels whose destination is this account.

result.name: result
result.description: A list of payment channels where the account is the source of the channel.

methods.name: account_currencies
methods.description: The account_currencies command retrieves a list of currencies that an account can send or receive, based on its trust lines. (This is not a thoroughly confirmed list, but it can be used to populate user interfaces.)

result.name: result
result.description: A list of currencies that an account can send or receive.

methods.name: account_info
methods.description: The account_info command retrieves information about an account, its activity, and its XRP balance. All information retrieved is relative to a particular version of the ledger.

params.name: signer_lists
params.description: If true, and the MultiSign amendment is enabled, also returns any SignerList objects associated with this account.

result.name: result
result.description: Basic data about an account.

methods.name: account_lines
methods.description: The account_lines method returns information about an account's trust lines, including balances in all non-XRP currencies and assets. All information retrieved is relative to a particular version of the ledger.

params.name: peer
params.description: The Address of a second account. If provided, show only lines of trust connecting the two accounts.

result.name: result
result.description: Info about an account's trust lines.

methods.name: account_objects
methods.description: The account_objects command returns the raw ledger format for all objects owned by an account. For a higher-level view of an account's trust lines and balances, see the account_lines method instead.

params.name: type
params.description: If included, filter results to include only this type of ledger object. The valid types are: check, deposit_preauth, escrow, offer, payment_channel, signer_list, ticket, and state (trust line).

params.name: deletion_blockers_only
params.description: If true, the response only includes objects that would block this account from being deleted. The default is false.

result.name: result
result.description: All ledger objects owned by an account.

methods.name: account_offers
methods.description: The account_offers method retrieves a list of offers made by a given account that are outstanding as of a particular ledger version.

result.name: result
result.description: Info about an account's currency exchange offers.

methods.name: account_tx
methods.description: The account_tx method retrieves a list of transactions that involved the specified account.

params.name: ledger_index_min
params.description: Use to specify the earliest ledger to include transactions from. A value of -1 instructs the server to use the earliest validated ledger version available.

params.name: ledger_index_max
params.description: Use to specify the most recent ledger to include transactions from. A value of -1 instructs the server to use the most recent validated ledger version available.

params.name: forward
params.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, returns values indexed with the oldest ledger first. Otherwise, the results are indexed with the newest ledger first.

result.name: result
result.description: Info about an account's transactions.

methods.name: gateway_balances
methods.description: The gateway_balances command calculates the total balances issued by a given account, optionally excluding amounts held by operational addresses.

params.name: hotwallet
params.description: An operational address to exclude from the balances issued, or an array of such addresses.

result.name: result
result.description: Total amounts issued by an account.

methods.name: noripple_check
methods.description: The noripple_check command provides a quick way to check the status of the Default Ripple field for an account and the No Ripple flag of its trust lines, compared with the recommended settings.

params.name: role
params.description: Whether the address refers to a gateway or user. Recommendations depend on the role of the account. Issuers must have Default Ripple enabled and must disable No Ripple on all trust lines. Users should have Default Ripple disabled, and should enable No Ripple on all trust lines.

result.name: result
result.description: Recommended changes to an account's Default Ripple and No Ripple settings.

methods.name: ledger
methods.description: Retrieve information about the public ledger.

params.name: full
params.description: Admin required. If true, return full information on the entire ledger. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version. Defaults to false. (Equivalent to enabling transactions, accounts, and expand.) Caution: This is a very large amount of data -- on the order of several hundred megabytes!

params.name: accounts
params.description: Admin required. If true, return information on accounts in the ledger. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version. Defaults to false. Caution: This returns a very large amount of data!

params.name: expand
params.description: Provide full JSON-formatted information for transaction/account information instead of only hashes. Defaults to false. Ignored unless you request transactions, accounts, or both.

params.name: owner_funds
params.description: If true, include owner_funds field in the metadata of OfferCreate transactions in the response. Defaults to false. Ignored unless transactions are included and expand is true.

result.name: result
result.description: Info about a ledger version.

methods.name: ledger_closed
methods.description: Get the latest closed ledger version.

result.name: result
result.description: The unique identifiers of the most recently closed ledger.

methods.name: ledger_current
methods.description: Get the current working ledger version.

result.name: result
result.description: The unique identifiers of the current in-progress ledger.

methods.name: ledger_data
methods.description: Get the raw contents of a ledger version.

result.name: result
result.description: Contents of the specified ledger.

methods.name: ledger_entry
methods.description: Get one element from a ledger version.

params.name: index
params.description: Specify the object ID of a single object to retrieve from the ledger.

params.name: account_root
params.description: Specify an AccountRoot object to retrieve.

params.name: check
params.description: Specify the object ID of a Check object to retrieve.

params.name: deposit_preauth
params.description: Specify a DepositPreauth object to retrieve. If a string, must be the object ID of the DepositPreauth object, as hexadecimal. If an object, requires owner and authorized sub-fields.

params.name: directory
params.description: Specify a DirectoryNode to retrieve. If a string, must be the object ID of the directory, as hexadecimal. If an object, requires either dir_root or owner as a sub-field, plus optionally a sub_index sub-field.

params.name: escrow
params.description: Specify an Escrow object to retrieve. If a string, must be the object ID of the Escrow, as hexadecimal. If an object, requires owner and seq sub-fields.

params.name: offer
params.description: Specify an Offer object to retrieve. If a string, interpret as the unique index to the Offer. If an object, requires the sub-fields account and seq to uniquely identify the offer.

params.name: payment_channel
params.description: Specify the object ID of a PayChannel object to retrieve.

params.name: ripple_state
params.description: Object specifying the RippleState (trust line) object to retrieve. The accounts and currency sub-fields are required to uniquely specify the RippleState entry to retrieve.

result.name: result
result.description: A single ledger object from the XRP Ledger in its raw format.

methods.name: sign
methods.description: Cryptographically sign a transaction.

params.name: offline
params.description: If true, when constructing the transaction, do not try to automatically fill any transaction details. The default is false.

params.name: build_path
params.description: If this field is provided, the server auto-fills the Paths field of a Payment transaction before signing. You must omit this field if the transaction is a direct XRP payment or if it is not a Payment-type transaction. Caution: The server looks for the presence or absence of this field, not its value. This behavior may change.

params.name: fee_mult_max
params.description: Signing fails with the error rpcHIGH_FEE if the auto-filled Fee value would be greater than the reference transaction cost × fee_mult_max ÷ fee_div_max. This field has no effect if you explicitly specify the Fee field of the transaction. The default is 10.

params.name: fee_div_max
params.description: Signing fails with the error rpcHIGH_FEE if the auto-filled Fee value would be greater than the reference transaction cost × fee_mult_max ÷ fee_div_max. This field has no effect if you explicitly specify the Fee field of the transaction. The default is 1.

result.name: result
result.description: A signed binary representation of the transaction.

methods.name: sign_for
methods.description: Contribute to a multi-signature.

result.name: result
result.description: Signed transaction.

methods.name: submit
methods.description: Send a transaction to the network.

params.name: tx_blob
params.description: Hex representation of the signed transaction to submit. This can be a multi-signed transaction.

result.name: result
result.description: The complete transaction and engine result.

methods.name: submit_multisigned
methods.description: Send a multi-signed transaction to the network.

result.name: result
result.description: The complete transaction and engine result.

methods.name: transaction_entry
methods.description: Retrieve info about a transaction from a particular ledger version.

params.name: tx_hash
params.description: Unique hash of the transaction you are looking up

methods.name: tx
methods.description: Retrieve info about a transaction from all the ledgers on hand.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The 256-bit hash of the transaction, as hex.

params.name: min_ledger
params.description: Use this with max_ledger to specify a range of up to 1000 ledger indexes, starting with this ledger (inclusive).

params.name: max_ledger
params.description: Use this with min_ledger to specify a range of up to 1000 ledger indexes, ending with this ledger (inclusive).

result.name: result
result.description: Information on a single transaction, by its identifying hash.

methods.name: tx_history
methods.description: Retrieve info about all recent transactions.

params.name: start
params.description: Number of transactions to skip over.

result.name: result
result.description: Some of the most recent transactions made.

methods.name: book_offers
methods.description: Get info about offers to exchange two currencies.

params.name: taker
params.description: The Address of an account to use as a perspective.

params.name: taker_gets
params.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the offer would receive, as an object with currency and issuer fields (omit issuer for XRP).

params.name: taker_pays
params.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the offer would pay, as an object with currency and issuer fields (omit issuer for XRP).

result.name: result
result.description: A list of offers, also known as the order book, between two currencies.

methods.name: deposit_authorized
methods.description: Check whether an account is authorized to send money directly to another.

result.name: result
result.description: Indicates whether one account is authorized to send payments directly to another.

methods.name: path_find
methods.description: Find a path for a payment between two accounts and receive updates.

params.name: subcommand
params.description: There are three different modes, or sub-commands, of the path_find command.

params.name: paths
params.description: Array of arrays of objects, representing payment paths to check.

result.name: result
result.description: A path along which a transaction can possibly be made.

methods.name: ripple_path_find
methods.description: Find a path for payment between two accounts, once.

params.name: send_max
params.description: Currency Amount that would be spent in the transaction. Cannot be used with source_currencies.

params.name: source_currencies
params.description: Array of currencies that the source account might want to spend. Each entry in the array should be a JSON object with a mandatory currency field and optional issuer field, like how currency amounts are specified. Cannot contain more than 18 source currencies. By default, uses all source currencies available up to a maximum of 88 different currency/issuer pairs.

result.name: result
result.description: A payment path you can use right away.

methods.name: channel_authorize
methods.description: Sign a claim for money from a payment channel.

params.name: channel_id
params.description: The unique ID of the payment channel to use.

result.name: result
result.description: A signature that can be used to redeem a specific amount of XRP from a payment channel.

methods.name: channel_verify
methods.description: Check a payment channel claim's signature.

params.name: channel_id
params.description: The Channel ID of the channel that provides the XRP. This is a 64-character hexadecimal string.

params.name: public_key
params.description: The public key of the channel and the key pair that was used to create the signature, in hexadecimal or the XRP Ledger's base58 format.

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature to verify, in hexadecimal.

result.name: result
result.description: A signature that can be used to redeem a specific amount of XRP from a payment channel

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description: Listen for updates about a particular subject.

params.name: url
params.description: URL where the server sends a JSON-RPC callbacks for each event. Admin-only.

params.name: url_username
params.description: Username to provide for basic authentication at the callback URL.

params.name: url_password
params.description: Password to provide for basic authentication at the callback URL.

result.name: result
result.description: Periodic notifications from the server when certain events happen.

methods.name: unsubscribe
methods.description: Stop listening for updates about a particular subject.Stop listening for updates about a particular subject.

result.name: result
result.description: Confirmation of unsubscribing.

methods.name: fee
methods.description: Get information about transaction cost. This requires the FeeEscalation amendment to be enabled.

result.name: result
result.description: The current state of the open-ledger requirements for the transaction cost.

methods.name: server_info
methods.description: Retrieve status of the server in human-readable format.

result.name: result
result.description: Human-readable version of various information about the rippled server being queried.

methods.name: server_state
methods.description: Retrieve status of the server in machine-readable format.

result.name: result
result.description: Machine-readable information about the rippled server's current state.

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Confirm connectivity with the server.

result.name: result
result.description: An acknowledgement, so that clients can test the connection status and latency.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Generate a random number.

result.name: result
result.description: A random number to be used as a source of entropy for random number generation by clients.

Account.description: The unique address of the account that initiated the transaction.

Fee.description: Integer amount of XRP, in drops, to be destroyed as a cost for distributing this transaction to the network.

Sequence.description: The sequence number of the account sending the transaction. A transaction is only valid if the Sequence number is exactly 1 greater than the previous transaction from the same account. The special case 0 means the transaction is using a Ticket instead

AccountTxnID.description: Hash value identifying another transaction. If provided, this transaction is only valid if the sending account's previously-sent transaction matches the provided hash.

Flags.description: Set of bit-flags for this transaction.

LastLedgerSequence.description: Highest ledger index this transaction can appear in. Specifying this field places a strict upper limit on how long the transaction can wait to be validated or rejected.

Memos.description: Additional arbitrary information used to identify this transaction.

Signers.description: Array of objects that represent a multi-signature which authorizes this transaction.

SourceTag.description: Arbitrary integer used to identify the reason for this payment, or a sender on whose behalf this transaction is made. Conventionally, a refund should specify the initial payment's SourceTag as the refund payment's DestinationTag.

SigningPubKey.description: (Automatically added when signing) Hex representation of the public key that corresponds to the private key used to sign this transaction. If an empty string, indicates a multi-signature is present in the Signers field instead.

TicketSequence.description: The sequence number of the ticket to use in place of a Sequence number. If this is provided, Sequence must be 0. Cannot be used with AccountTxnID.

TxnSignature.description: (Automatically added when signing) The signature that verifies this transaction as originating from the account it says it is from.

owner.description: The account that provided the preauthorization.

authorized.description: The account that received the preauthorization.

DirectoryNode.description: Provides a list of links to other objects in the ledger's state tree. Requires either dir_root or owner as a sub-field, plus optionally a sub_index sub-field.

owner.description: The address of the account that owns the objects in this directory.

sub_index.description: If provided, jumps to a later 'page' of the DirectoryNode.

dir_root.description: Unique index identifying the directory to retrieve, as a hex string.

owner.description: The owner (sender) of the Escrow object.

sec.description: The sequence number of the transaction that created the Escrow object.

account.description: The account that placed the offer.

seq.description: The sequence number of the transaction that created the Offer object.

RippleState.description: Object specifying the RippleState (trust line) object to retrieve. The accounts and currency sub-fields are required to uniquely specify the RippleState entry to retrieve.

accounts.description: 2-length array of account Addresses, defining the two accounts linked by this RippleState object.

Currency.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the Offer would receive, as a currency object with no amount.

CurrencyObject.description: A currency specification object (for issued currencies).

value.description: Amounts of currency for both XRP and issued currencies.

issuer.description: Unique account address of the entity issuing the currency. In other words, the person or business where the currency can be redeemed.

Taker.description: Unique account address to use as a perspective for viewing offers, in the XRP Ledger's base58 format.

TakerGets.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the Offer would receive, as a currency object with no amount.

TakerPays.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the Offer would pay, as a currency object with no amount.

snapshot.description: If true, return the current state of the order book once when you subscribe before sending updates. The default is false.

both.description: If true, return both sides of the order book. The default is false.

taker_gets.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the Offer would receive, as a currency object with no amount.

taker_pays.description: Specification of which currency the account taking the Offer would pay, as a currency object with no amount.

both.description: If true, return both sides of the order book. The default is false.

Account.name: account
Account.description: The unique identifier of an account, typically the account's Address.

LedgerHash.name: ledger_hash
LedgerHash.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

LedgerIndex.name: ledger_index
LedgerIndex.description: The ledger index of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string ('current', 'closed', or 'validated') to choose a ledger automatically.

Strict.name: strict
Strict.description: If true, then the account field only accepts a public key or XRP Ledger address. Otherwise, account can be a secret or passphrase (not recommended). The default is false.

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description: Limit the number of transactions to retrieve. Cannot be less than 10 or more than 400. The default is 200.

Marker.name: marker
Marker.description: Value from a previous paginated response. Resume retrieving data where that response left off.

FailHard.name: fail_hard
FailHard.description: If true, and the transaction fails locally, do not retry or relay the transaction to other servers

Secret.name: secret
Secret.description: The secret key to use to sign the claim. This must be the same key pair as the public key specified in the channel. Cannot be used with seed, seed_hex, or passphrase.

Seed.name: seed
Seed.description: The secret seed to use to sign the claim. This must be the same key pair as the public key specified in the channel. Must be in the XRP Ledger's base58 format. If provided, you must also specify the key_type. Cannot be used with secret, seed_hex, or passphrase.

SeedHex.name: seed_hex
SeedHex.description: The secret seed to use to sign the claim. This must be the same key pair as the public key specified in the channel. Must be in hexadecimal format. If provided, you must also specify the key_type. Cannot be used with secret, seed, or passphrase.

Passphrase.name: passphrase
Passphrase.description: A string passphrase to use to sign the claim. This must be the same key pair as the public key specified in the channel. The key derived from this passphrase must match the public key specified in the channel. If provided, you must also specify the key_type. Cannot be used with secret, seed, or seed_hex.

KeyType.name: key_type
KeyType.description: The signing algorithm of the cryptographic key pair provided. Valid types are secp256k1 or ed25519. The default is secp256k1.

Transactions.name: transactions
Transactions.description: If true, return information on transactions in the specified ledger version. Defaults to false. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version.

Binary.name: binary
Binary.description: Return transaction information in binary format (hexadecimal string) instead of JSON format.

Queue.name: queue
Queue.description: If true, and the command is requesting the current ledger, includes an array of queued transactions in the results.

Amount.name: amount
Amount.description: The amount of XRP, in drops, the provided signature authorizes.

Streams.name: streams
Streams.description: Array of string names of generic streams to subscribe to.

Accounts.name: accounts
Accounts.description: Array with the unique addresses of accounts to monitor for validated transactions.

AccountsProposed.name: accounts_proposed
AccountsProposed.description: Array with the unique addresses of accounts to monitor for validated transactions, include transactions that are not yet finalized.

SourceAccount.name: source_account
SourceAccount.description: Unique address of the account that would send funds in a transaction.

DestinationAccount.name: destination_account
DestinationAccount.description: Unique address of the account that would receive funds in a transaction.

DestinationAmount.name: destination_amount
DestinationAmount.description: Currency Amount that the destination account would receive in a transaction.

SendMax.name: send_max
SendMax.description: Currency Amount that would be spent in the transaction. Cannot be used with source_currencies.

Books.name: books
Books.description: Array of objects defining order books to monitor for updates.

BooksUnsubscribe.name: books_unsubscribe
BooksUnsubscribe.description: The objects in the books array are defined almost like the ones from subscribe, except that they don't have all the fields.
